crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET ATTACK_RESPONSE Havoc/Sliver Framework TLS Certificate Observed

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert icmp $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP Unusual PING detected"; icode:0; itype:8; fragbits:!M; content:!"ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWABCDEFGHI",depth 32; content:!"0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuv",depth 32; content:!"EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE",depth 36; content:!"WANG2"; content:!"cacti-monitoring-system",depth 65; content:!"SolarWinds",depth 72; metadata:policy max-detect-ips drop,ruleset community; reference:url,krebsonsecurity.com/2014/01/a-closer-look-at-the-target-malware-part-ii/; reference:url,krebsonsecurity.com/2014/01/a-first-look-at-the-target-intrusion-malware/; classtype:successful-recon-limited; sid:29456; rev:3; )

alert http $HOME_NET any -> any any (msg:"ET INFO Python SimpleHTTP ServerBanner"; flow:established; http.server; content:"SimpleHTTP/"; startswith; content:"Python/"; distance:0; reference:url,wiki.python.org/moin/BaseHttpServer; classtype:misc-activity; sid:2034636; rev:2; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2021_12_08, deployment Perimeter, confidence High, signature_severity Minor, updated_at 2021_12_08;)

alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Observed UA-CPU Header"; flow:established,to_server; http.header_names; content:"|0d 0a|ua-cpu|0d 0a|"; nocase; threshold: type limit, track by_src, seconds 180, count 1; reference:url,oreilly.com/library/view/http-the-definitive/1565925092/re52.html; classtype:misc-activity; sid:2062715; rev:1; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2025_06_03, deployment Perimeter, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2025_06_03;)
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP PING Windows"; itype:8; content:"abcdefghijklmnop",depth 16; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:382; rev:11; )
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP PING"; icode:0; itype:8; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:384; rev:8; )
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP Echo Reply"; icode:0; itype:0; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:408; rev:8; )

threat_severity.level_description: Severity MEDIUM because it was considered trojan.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Outbound Network Connection Initiated By Script Interpreter
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a script interpreter wscript/cscript opening a network connection to a non-local network. Adversaries may use script to download malicious payloads.

match_context.values: @{SourceIsIpv6=false; DestinationPort=53; DestinationIp=8.8.8.8; Protocol=udp; SourceIp=192.168.122.130; DestinationIsIpv6=false; EventID=3; Image=C:\Windows\System32\cscript.exe; SourcePort=61931; Initiated=true}

@{SourceIsIpv6=false; DestinationPort=8080; Initiated=true; Protocol=tcp; SourceIp=192.168.122.130; DestinationIsIpv6=false; EventID=3; SourcePort=49165; Image=C:\Windows\System32\cscript.exe; DestinationIp=18.228.31.163}

@{SourceIsIpv6=false; DestinationPort=8080; DestinationIp=18.228.31.163; Protocol=tcp; SourceIp=172.16.1.9; DestinationIsIpv6=false; EventID=3; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\wscript.exe; SourcePort=51152; Initiated=true}

@{SourceIsIpv6=false; DestinationPort=8080; DestinationIp=18.228.31.163; Protocol=tcp; SourceIp=192.168.122.100; DestinationIsIpv6=false; EventID=3; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WScript.exe; SourcePort=49722; Initiated=true}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects programs that connect to uncommon destination ports

match_context.values: @{SourceIsIpv6=false; DestinationPort=8080; DestinationIp=18.228.31.163; Protocol=tcp; SourceIp=192.168.122.130; DestinationIsIpv6=false; EventID=3; SourcePort=49165; Image=C:\Windows\System32\cscript.exe; Initiated=true}

@{SourceIsIpv6=false; DestinationPort=8080; Initiated=true; Protocol=tcp; SourceIp=172.16.1.9; DestinationIsIpv6=false; EventID=3; SourcePort=51152; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\wscript.exe; DestinationIp=18.228.31.163}

@{SourceIsIpv6=false; DestinationPort=8080; Initiated=true; Protocol=tcp; SourceIp=192.168.122.100; DestinationIsIpv6=false; EventID=3; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WScript.exe; SourcePort=49722; DestinationIp=18.228.31.163}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Read Contents From Stdin Via Cmd.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detect the use of "<" to read and potentially execute a file via cmd.exe

match_context.values: @{CommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe /c tasklist /FI imagename eq SAPINFO.EXE > C:\Users\<USER>\t.log; Image=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; EventID=1}

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis:
The script first defines variables for a URL, zip file name, executable file name, user's home directory, and output file.

The function `vProc` checks if a given process name (`pName`) is running. It creates a log file, executes the `tasklist` command to search for the process, reads the log file, and deletes it. If the process is found, it returns `True`; otherwise, it returns `False`.

The script then calls `vProc` to check if the executable `SAPInfo.exe` is running. If it is, the script quits. Otherwise, the script sleeps for 5 seconds and checks again. If the executable is running after the sleep, the script quits.

The `getFile` subroutine downloads a file from a given URL (`fUrl`). It uses `MSXML2.XMLHTTP` to send a GET request to the URL and saves the response body to a file specified by `file_out`.

The `extractFile` subroutine extracts the contents of a zip file (`zipFile`) to a destination folder (`destFolder`) using `Shell.Application`.

The script then calls the `getFile` subroutine with the URL specified in the `url` variable.

The script then checks if the zip file and executable file exist in the user's home directory, deleting them if they exist.

The script renames `file_out` to the zip file name in the user's home directory.

The script then checks if `file_out` exists and deletes it.

The script then extracts the downloaded zip file to the user's home directory.

Finally, the script executes the extracted executable file.
